Sentencas: Solid oxide carbon fuel cells (SO-CFCs), which are a part of direct carbon fuel cells (DCFCs), adopt the same chemistry of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Origin of peculiar electrochemical phenomena in direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: Despite their same chemistry, a difference in electrochemical behaviors has been observed.
Titulo: Origin of peculiar electrochemical phenomena in direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: Unlike SOFCs where gas is imposed as fuel, SO-CFCs employ solid-state carbonaceous fuel that undergoes gasification and produces gaseous fuel such as carbon monoxide (CO).
Titulo: Origin of peculiar electrochemical phenomena in direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: The amount of CO production varies according to the physicochemical properties of carbon source.
Titulo: Origin of peculiar electrochemical phenomena in direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: In this contribution, the authors prove that the plethora or lack of CO in SO-CFCs can cause poisoning on Ni electrocatalyst and thereby a decrease in electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Origin of peculiar electrochemical phenomena in direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: The authors demonstrate poisoning mechanisms and they finally suggest methodologies to overcome or alleviate the poisonings.
Titulo: Origin of peculiar electrochemical phenomena in direct carbon fuel cells
